what_is.title: What is Frankencoin?
what_is.subtitle: Frankencoin is a stablecoin that tracks the value of the Swiss franc.

explanation.title: Swiss Franc Stablecoin
explanation.description: Frankencoin (ZCHF) is a digital currency that maintains a stable 1:1 value with the Swiss franc. It combines the stability of Switzerland's trusted currency with the transparency and openness of the blockchain.

explanation.title: Fully Decentralized
explanation.description: Unlike centralized stablecoins, the value of the Frankencoin does not depend on an issuer that guarantees its value. Instead, the Frankencoin is backed by on-chain collateral that can be liquidated if necessary to maintain its value.

explanation.title: Live and Established
explanation.description: Frankencoin has been deployed on 8 different blockchains. It is the largest and most popular Swiss franc stablecoin, enabling on-chain transactions in Swiss francs since 2023 with no significant deviations from its peg.

how_it_works.title: The Frankencoin System at a Glance
how_it_works.subtitle: Frankencoin is a fully transparent, rule-based, decentralized, modular, and neutral financial infrastructure.

description.content: Frankencoins can be created by anyone that deposits a suitable collateral.
The collateral remains locked until its owner returns the created Frankencoins (plus fees) again.
Newly minted Frankencoins are typically sold in the market.
Users can buy Frankencoins on various trading venues.
They might want to use Frankencoins to make Swiss franc payments in DeFi or elsewhere.

explanation.title: Collateralized debt position
explanation.description: Frankencoin operates as a decentralized collateralized debt position system. Users deposit crypto assets as collateral to mint digital Swiss francs (ZCHF). The collateral remains under the user's control while securing the outstanding franc issuance, similar to a secured lending facility with transparent, automated terms.

explanation.title: Why 1 ZCHF equals 1 CHF
explanation.description: Frankencoins are over-collateralized, such that each Frankencoin is always backed by at least one Swiss franc worth of assets. The assets backing the Frankencoins are publicly visible on-chain.

explanation.title: Market-driven price stability
explanation.description: The system is designed to keep the long-term value of the Frankencoin in line with the Swiss franc. This means that every short-term deviation is an arbitrage opportunity for the market to expoit, thereby keeping the exchange rate close to parity.

regulatory.title: Legal Classification
regulatory.description: The system is fully compliant with Swiss and EU regulations and can be used without restrictions. Frankencoin (ZCHF) classifies as a payment token in Switzerland and qualifies as a crypto-asset under MiCAR, with the duties set out in Titles II, III, and IV not being applicable due to its decentralized nature.

audits.title: Technical Audits
audits.description: The Frankencoin and each added component has been audited by leading blockchain security firms. The audits cover smart contract security, economic design, and overall system integrity to ensure a robust and secure platform for users.

foundation.title: Theoretical Foundation
foundation.description: The Frankencoin was conceived a part of [a PhD thesis](https://www.zora.uzh.ch/id/eprint/259657/1/259657.pdf) completed at the Department of Finance at the University of Zurich. Among other things, it covers the game theory behind the system's novel liquidation mechanism, quantifies the risk of Bitcoin as a collateral, and it formally analyses the veto-based governance system. The Frankencoin system can be seen as a Continuous Capital Corporation, a concept introduced in chapter three denoting a company that issues and redeems shares autonomously according to fixed rules that are optimal under a wide range of theoretical assumptions.
